intro: Ferula hindukushensis, commonly known as the Hindukush ferula, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its tall, branched stems and narrow leaves. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers arranged in complex umbels, typical of the family. Its roots are thick and fleshy, often containing aromatic compounds. Ferula hindukushensis is adapted to high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats.
